title: Wrappers to Simplify Beautiful ggplot2 Visualisation
text: {ggblanket} package wrapper functions around amazing {ggplot2} package. objective make beautiful {ggplot2} visualisation simpler. mind, {ggblanket} package: uses quick functions wrap around single geom merges col fill aesthetics single col aesthetic provides colour customisation via pal argument treats faceting aesthetic pushes x y limits max x y breaks default arranges horizontal geom y col labels etc correct order converts titles sentence case default converts numeric labels comma format default provides arguments scale adjustment legend placement allows users access non-aesthetic geom functionality changes default colours, alphas, widths themes

title: Wrappers to Simplify Beautiful ggplot2 Visualisation
text: Install either CRAN : install development version :
code: install.packages("ggblanket") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("davidhodge931/ggblanket")

title: Wrappers to Simplify Beautiful ggplot2 Visualisation
text: examples
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggblanket)  penguins2 <- palmerpenguins::penguins %>%    tidyr::drop_na() %>%    mutate(body_mass_kg = body_mass_g / 1000) %>%    mutate(sex = stringr::str_to_sentence(sex)) penguins2 %>%    ggplot() +   geom_histogram(aes(x = body_mass_kg)) penguins2 %>%    gg_histogram(x = body_mass_kg) penguins2 %>%   group_by(species, sex, island) %>%   summarise(body_mass_kg = mean(body_mass_kg)) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_col(     aes(x = body_mass_kg, y = species, fill = sex),      position = "dodge"     ) +   facet_wrap( ~ island) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom") penguins2 %>%   group_by(species, sex, island) %>%   summarise(body_mass_kg = mean(body_mass_kg)) %>%   gg_col(     x = body_mass_kg,     y = species,     col = sex,     facet = island,     position = "dodge",     col_legend_place = "b"   ) storms %>%    group_by(year) %>%    summarise(wind = mean(wind, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%    gg_line(x = year,            y = wind,            y_zero = TRUE,           x_labels = ~.x,            title = "Storm wind speed",           subtitle = "USA average storm wind speed, 1975\u20132020",            y_title = "Wind speed (knots)",            caption = "Source: NOAA",           theme = gg_theme(y_grid = TRUE)) +   geom_point() penguins2 %>%    gg_density(     x = body_mass_kg,      col = species,      facet = sex,      col_legend_place = "b") penguins2 %>%   gg_jitter(     x = species,     y = body_mass_g,     col = flipper_length_mm,     col_intervals = ~santoku::chop_quantiles(.x, probs = seq(0, 1, 0.25)),     position = position_jitter(width = 0.2, height = 0, seed = 123),      y_zero = TRUE) penguins2 %>%    gg_smooth(     x = bill_length_mm,     y = flipper_length_mm,     col = species,     ) penguins2 %>%   gg_histogram(     x = body_mass_kg,     col = species,      facet = sex,      col_legend_place = "b",      pal = pals::brewer.dark2(3)) df <- data.frame(   trt = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2)),   resp = c(1, 5, 3, 4),   group = factor(c(1, 2, 1, 2)),   upper = c(1.1, 5.3, 3.3, 4.2),   lower = c(0.8, 4.6, 2.4, 3.6) )  dodger <- position_dodge(width = 0.75)  gg_blank(df, x = resp, xmin = lower, xmax = upper, y = trt, col = group) +   geom_col(position = dodger, width = 0.75, alpha = 0.9) +   geom_errorbar(position = dodger, width = 0.2, col = "#232323")

title: Bar ggplot. — gg_bar
text: ggplot object.

title: Bar ggplot. — gg_bar
code: library(ggplot2) gg_bar(mpg, x = class) #> Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will #> replace the existing scale.  gg_bar(mpg, y = class) #> Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will #> replace the existing scale.  gg_bar(mpg, x = class, col = drv) #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic #> Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will #> replace the existing scale.  gg_bar(mpg, y = class, col = drv, col_legend_place = "t") #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic #> Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will #> replace the existing scale.

code: library(ggplot2)  df <- data.frame(   trt = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2)),   resp = c(1, 5, 3, 4),   group = factor(c(1, 2, 1, 2)),   upper = c(1.1, 5.3, 3.3, 4.2),   lower = c(0.8, 4.6, 2.4, 3.6) )  dodger <- position_dodge(width = 0.75)  gg_blank(df, x = trt, y = resp, ymin = lower, ymax = upper, col = group) +   geom_col(position = dodger, width = 0.75) +   geom_errorbar(position = dodger, width = 0.2, col = "#232323") #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic

Adding another scale for 'y', which will #> replace the existing scale.   gg_errorbar(df, x = trt, y = resp, ymin = lower, ymax = upper, col = group) +   geom_line(aes(group = group)) +   geom_point() #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic   dodger <- position_dodge(width = 0.75)  gg_blank(df, x = trt, y = resp, ymin = lower, ymax = upper, col = group) +   geom_col(position = dodger, width = 0.75) +   geom_errorbar(aes(x = trt, ymin = lower, ymax = upper, group = group),                 inherit.aes = FALSE,                 position = dodger,                 width = 0.1) #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic

title: Quick theme for a ggplot. — gg_theme
text: font font text use. Defaults "". font_title font title. NULL, inherits font argument. font_subtitle font subtitle. NULL, inherits font argument. font_body font text title, subtitle caption. NULL, inherits font argument. font_caption font caption. NULL, inherits font argument. size_title size title font. Defaults 11. size_subtitle size subtitle font. Defaults 10. size_body size text title, subtitle caption. Defaults 10. size_caption size caption. Defaults 9. size_axis size axis. Defaults 0.3. size_ticks size ticks. Defaults 0.3. size_grid size vertical major gridlines. Defaults 0.2. style_title style title font. Defaults "bold". style_subtitle style subtitle font. Defaults "plain". style_body style text title, subtitle caption. Defaults "plain". style_caption style caption. Defaults "plain". pal_title colour palette title font. Defaults "#000000". pal_subtitle colour palette subtitle font. Defaults "#323232". pal_body colour palette text title, subtitle caption. Defaults "#323232". pal_caption colour palette caption. Defaults "#7F7F7F". pal_axis colour palette axis. Defaults "#323232". pal_ticks colour palette ticks. Defaults "#323232". pal_background two colour vector. first colour panel (legend key). second colour rest background. pal_grid colour palette vertical major gridlines. Defaults "#D3D3D3". x_grid TRUE FALSE whether show vertical gridlines. y_grid TRUE FALSE whether show hotizontal gridlines. void TRUE FALSE whether drop axis lines, ticks x y labels. Useful maps. Defaults FALSE.

title: Tile ggplot. — gg_tile
code: library(ggplot2)  df <- data.frame(   x = rep(c(2, 5, 7, 9, 12), 2),   y = rep(c(1, 2), each = 5),   z = factor(rep(1:5, each = 2)),   w = rep(diff(c(0, 4, 6, 8, 10, 14)), 2) )  gg_tile(df, x = x, y = y, col = z) #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic  gg_tile(df, x = x, y = y, width = w, col = z) #> ℹ {ggblanket} merges col and fill aesthetics into a single col aesthetic
